title: Saintes-Marie-de-la-Mer Roman Port
description: A Roman commercial port near the modern French town of Saintes-Maries-de-la-Mer is attested by over forty Roman-era shipwrecks discovered in the area since the 1990s, most carrying cargoes of metal. The excavators posit in Roman times a significantly different coastline (generally further south) and an old mouth of the Rhone (Ancien Rhône de Saint-Ferréol), located to the east of Saintes-Maries-de-la-Mer (Long 2011, Figure 1).

properties.description: Location based on OpenStreetMap, with reference to Gosselin 2023, Figure 1.
properties.title: OSM Location of modern Saintes-Maries-de-la-Mer

properties.description: After Gosselin 2023, Figure 1 and Long 2011, Figure 1.
properties.title: Imagery Location: Approximate Centerpoint of Wreck Scatter

properties.description: The Grau de la Fourcade is the sea channel now occupying the point where the old Saint-Ferréol branch of the Rhone once debouched into the sea, a feature thought by the excavators to have been in place in Roman times.
properties.title: Imagery Location: Grau de la Fourcade / Saintes-Maries-de-la-Mer
